body.p:
To the Honbl Beriah Maggoffin
Governor of Comth of Ky.

Your petitioner would represent that at the December term 1861 a judgment was rendered by the Henderson Circuit Court in favore of the Comth against Mrs Hannah E Grant for the sum of Twenty ($2000) and costs, being a fine for selling liquor to a slave of James Rouse, Defendent proved on the trial that James Rouse had told defedant to let his negro have liquor whenever he called for it. This order of James Rouse was only a verbal order, the law requiring a written order, the evidence was excluded and said judgment was rendered. It was wholly thought ignorance of the law, and not a desire to violate or evade the law on the part of defendent, -- Times are extremely hard and defendent has no money to pay off said judgments it is as much as she can do to make enough to support her family -- Her husband is dead and she has a number of children to support, Wherefore we ask that the fine aforesaid be remitted &c
Henderson Ky April 1st 1862.
I hope Governor Magoffin will remit the within fine
